author: josephnicholas
content: Hello, how can a regular developer be able to contribute with this project?

author: protolambda
content: <@544703121675386880> Hey, what are you interested in most? Front end? Smart contracts? Back end? And which languages etc. There are many things to work on

author: josephnicholas
content: <@203220829473996800> Mostly I am interested in a R&D development kind of standpoint mostly core components. Mostly in my career I have been developing C++ applications with Windows MFC(mostly C++98 stuff). Currently, also doing some Kotlin developnent with Spring Framework(still kinda newbie) and some Corda smart contract development

author: josephnicholas
content: I also attended and paasws the Consensys Dev bootcamp, so I have some overview of how Eth works..

author: protolambda
content:
<@544703121675386880> If you like kotlin you should talk to the folks of Teku, the Consensys client developed by <@&595683059651706974> 
Regarding core components, the spec bug bounty program is being reintroduced soon, so you can look into that.

author: josephnicholas
content: <@203220829473996800> thanks, are there any C++ development going on?

author: protolambda
content: Not really, except for pure cryptography that is then embedded into a client as a library

author: protolambda
content: If you like low level languages with advanced features, you may want to try Rust (lighthouse) or Nim (nimbus)

author: protolambda
content: See pinned message in <#598292067260825641> to find the lighthouse and nimbus discord üëç
